pullRequest.body:
We prove that any simplicial set satisfying the `StrictSegal` condition introduced in #18499 is a quasicategory. This implies that the nerve of a category is a quasicategory.

We construct a solution to the lifting problem against `hornInclusion n i` as a `spineToSimplex` of the path in the image of the spine of the standard simplex. 

To prove that this extension restricts to the appropriate map on the horn, we apply `spineInjective`, reducing the question of equality between two `n`-simplices in `X` to that of equality between the paths along their spines. The remainder of the proof is a straightforward application of basic properties relating spines of simplices to their faces.

Co-Authored-By: [Johan Commelin](https://github.com/jcommelin) and [Emily Riehl](https://github.com/emilyriehl)

---

### PR summary [1c93ad7e4f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19270/commits/1c93ad7e4f396cf1fd9d2a201b8f6a8e8e84231e)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.SimplicialSet.StrictSegal | 820 | 822 | +2 (+0.24%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.SimplicialSet.StrictSegal`|2|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Path.map`
`+ horn.spineId`
`+ horn.spineId_map_hornInclusion`
`+ id`
`+ id_eq_objEquiv_symm`
`+ instance : Quasicategory (nerve C) := inferInstance`
`+ instance : Quasicategory X := by`
`+ map_interval`
`+ mkOfSucc_δ_eq`
`+ mkOfSucc_δ_gt`
`+ mkOfSucc_δ_lt`
`+ objEquiv_id`
`+ spineToSimplex_map`
`+ spine_δ_arrow_eq`
`+ spine_δ_arrow_gt`
`+ spine_δ_arrow_lt`
`+ spine_δ_vertex_ge`
`+ spine_δ_vertex_lt`
`+ standardSimplex.spineId`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Apart from some suggestions about name changes, the code looks very good to me. I shall have a look at the main part of the proof somewhat later.
This approach is a lot cleaner than my original wombat approach. Excellent!

```suggestion
which sends `0` and `1` to `i` and `i + 2` respectively. -/
```
Would you recommend keeping the "picks out" language for the comments on the two lemmas above?
I think the phrasing should also be changed because it should be phrased in the language of ordered sets.

As this is in the `standardSimplex` namespace, `id` could be a good enough name:
```suggestion
def id (n : ℕ) : Δ[n] _[n] := yonedaEquiv Δ[n] [n] (𝟙 Δ[n])
```

```suggestion
lemma id_eq_objEquiv_symm (n : ℕ) :
```
You may also add a lemma `objEquiv_id`.

Doing as follows would allow the use of dot notation `f.map σ`:
```suggestion
def Path.map {X Y : SSet.{u}} {n : ℕ} (f : X.Path n) (σ : X ⟶ Y) : Y.Path n where
```
This may also apply to other definitions below.
This should be in the `standardSimplex` namespace, probably as `spineId`.

In general, does recommending moving something to another namespace imply that the definition should be moved to the file in which that namespace is defined? Or should it just be added to the namespace from its current location?

The ability to freely append to a namespace in Lean is still somewhat foreign to me.

In Lean, filenames and namespaces are independent. Here, this makes sense in the file `SimplicalSet.Path`, but it would be better in the `standardSimplex`, and it does not need to be moved to another file.

This may be moved to the `horn` namespace, and you may add the following lemma:
```lean
@[simp]
lemma horn.spine_map_hornInclusion {n : ℕ} (i : Fin (n + 3))
    (h₀ : 0 < i) (hₙ : i < Fin.last (n + 2)) :
    mapPath (hornInclusion (n + 2) i) (spineHorn i h₀ hₙ) = idSpine (n + 2) := rfl
```
I have renamed `spineHorn` to `horn.spineId` to reflect the fact that it is `standardSimplex.spineId` viewed as a path in the horn. Please let me know if this is too confusing, though.

Why not this form?
```suggestion
    idSimplex n = (objEquiv _ _).symm (𝟙 _) := rfl
```
This is much better, thanks.

```suggestion
lemma horn.spineId_map_hornInclusion {n : ℕ} (i : Fin (n + 3))
```

What is the naming pattern for the `lt/gt/le/ge/eq` suffices? Okay, `eq` is clear.

In
```
lemma mkOfSucc_δ_lt {n : ℕ} {i : Fin n} {j : Fin (n + 2)}
    (h : i.succ.castSucc < j) :
    mkOfSucc i ≫ δ j = mkOfSucc i.castSucc :=
```
The LHS of the conclusion has `i` appearing before `j`, and the condition is `i + 1 < j`. So that could be a reason to call this version `_lt`.
But in the lemma at hand, `i` appears before `j` in the conclusion, and the condition is `i > j`. So I would expect this version to be called `gt`.

Are you using a different convention?

Admittedly, it was a bit ad hoc, but my thinking was that a `_lt` suffix means `arrow < face` (or `vertex < face`). I also wanted `spine_δ_arrow_lt` to rewrite using `mkOfSucc_δ_lt`. If there is a convention that's more consistent with the rest of mathlib I'd be happy to change it.

I'm also thinking maybe I should switch the order of index arguments to `spine_δ_*` depending on the convention we settle on.
I don't have a strong opinion either.

I think I slightly prefer the geometric intuition of `_lt` implying `arrow index < face index`. I have updated some comments to more directly indicate this convention. I also reordered and renamed the arguments to `spine_δ_*` to better match those of  `mkOfSucc_δ_*`.

I will leave this comment unresolved in case anyone else has the opposite opinion on the convention here.

pullRequest.title: feat(AlgebraicTopology): StrictSegal simplicial sets are quasicategories
